# TCThrottle

**Class**

Represents a single on-screen throttle - a one axis input.

## Declaration

```swift
class TCThrottle
```

## Overview

This is mirrored by a `GCControllerButtonInput` on the associated `GCController` instance.

## Inspecting the throttle

- **backgroundContents**: The contents for the background of the throttle.
- **baseValue**: The initial value of this control.
- **highlightDuration**: The time it takes for a highlight to fade away, in seconds.
- **indicatorContents**: The contents for the indicator of the throttle.
- **indicatorSize**: The size (width, height) of the indicator itself in points.
- **snapsToBaseValue**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the control reverts to it’s base value.
- **throttleSize**: The size (width, height) of the throttle itself, providing boundaries for the indicator, in points.

## Getting the collider shape

- **colliderShape**: The collider shape for the throttle.
- **TCColliderShape**: Defines the shape of a control collider.

## Getting the orientation

- **orientation**: The orientation of the throttle.
- **TCThrottle.Orientation**: Defines the orientation of the throttle.

## Controls

- **TCControl**: A protocol that defines the base properties and methods for all touch controls.
- **TCButton**: A control that represents a single on-screen button.
- **TCDirectionPad**: An object that represents a direction pad.
- **TCSwitch**: A control that represents a single on-screen switch.
- **TCThumbstick**: Represents a single on-screen thumbstick.
- **TCTouchpad**: Represents a single on-screen touchpad that reports absolute coordinates or delta movements.
